sentences.en: ...a climate where ethnic minorities are continually scapegoated for the lack of jobs and housing problems.
sentences.cn: …一种屡屡把缺少工作职位和住房问题归罪于少数族裔的风气。

sentences.en: He claimed he had been a scapegoat for the administration's failures.
sentences.cn: 他声称自己成了行政管理失败的替罪羊.

sentences.en: He had been made the scapegoat for all the failures of the Luftwaffe.
sentences.cn: 他就是德国空军各次败绩的替罪羊.

sentences.en: He has been made a scapegoat for the company's failures.
sentences.cn: 他成了公司倒闭的替罪羊.

sentences.en: I can not let my boys be the scapegoat.
sentences.cn: 我不能让我的孩子当替罪羊.

sentences.en: I don't deserve to be made the scapegoat for a couple of bad results.
sentences.cn: 我不应该为一些不好的结果顶罪。

sentences.en: I don't think I deserve to be made the scapegoat for a couple of bad results.
sentences.cn: 我认为我不该为出现的一些不良后果充当替罪羊。

sentences.en: Media scapegoat, who they can be mad at today.
sentences.cn: 媒体的替罪羊, 他们指责的对象.

sentences.en: She felt she had been made a scapegoat for her boss's incompetence.
sentences.cn: 她觉得，本是老板无能，但她却成了替罪羊。

sentences.en: The essence of archaic religiosity is the scapegoat mechanism.
sentences.cn: 古代宗教狂热的本质,就是代罪羔羊的机制.

sentences.en: The politicians would try to make a scapegoat of him.
sentences.cn: 政客们要把他当作替死鬼.

sentences.en: They ask me to join the party so that I'll be their scapegoat when trouble comes.
sentences.cn: 他们想叫我入伙,出了乱子,好让我替他们垫背.

sentences.en: This means to be the scapegoat, to be blamed for something that someone else did.
sentences.cn: 它的意思是“替罪羊”, 也就是替人受过.

sentences.en: This reasoning holds obvious appeal for those for a scapegoat.
sentences.cn: 这种推理明显能够引起那些寻求替罪羊的人的兴趣.

sentences.en: This reasoning holds obvious appeal for those looking for a scapegoat.
sentences.cn: 这种推论显然对那些要找替罪羊的人来说很有吸引力.

sentences.en: Yet this President Bush is not a good scapegoat.
sentences.cn: 但这位布什总统却并非一只顺从的替罪羊.

sentences.en: You may say I'm making the school system a scapegoat.
sentences.cn: 或许你认为这么说是在推卸责任.

words.tran_cn: 替罪羊，替人顶罪者；替身

trans.tran_cn: 代人受过的人，替罪羊，替身
trans.tran_en: someone who is blamed for something bad that happens, even if it is not their fault
To scapegoat someone means to blame them publicly for something bad that has happened, even though it was not their fault
